availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Fidler (Marion County, Kentucky, teacher and soldier)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, teacher and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Fidler and Mary Fidler. Resident in Marion County in 1850. School teacher in Marion County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from November 21, 1861 to July 19, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 366B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 704.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon Precinct 6, p. 25.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 816.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 238.
